page.title: 09MIDHURST HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: Midhurst is very proud of its Health Centre which is almost unique in its service to the community.Opened in 1972,it is run by the N.H.S.32 people work there and it has 15 rooms.There is support from the social services and the ambulance service.The nurses and doctors each travel about 15O miles a week.The 6 doctors form a group practice and cover 12,OOO patients.They also hold weekly surgeries in 4 nearby villages.There are baby and other specialist clinics, child guidance and a treatment room for minor injuries,blood tests,E.C.Gs, injections and dressings.The general health level here is good although the proportion of elderly people is above the national average.There are 2 good hospitals within 13 miles but waiting lists are long.
